Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Multimodal Image-Guided Surgery in Colorectal Peritoneal Metastases

Trial_Design.evidence: A single-centre, open-label, phase II study

Participants.evidence: Patients aged ≥18 years with confirmed colorectal peritoneal metastases were included.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention involved intravenous administration of 10 mg 111 In-labelled DOTA–labetuzumab-IRDye800CW, followed by SPECT/CT and intraoperative radiodetection and NIRF imaging.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to validate the safety and feasibility of multimodal image-guided surgery

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the safety and feasibility of the procedure, assessed over a 10-day period post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: No randomisation or blinding was employed.

Blinding.evidence: No randomisation or blinding was employed.

Result_Outcome.evidence: NIRF imaging detected 34 (92%) of 37 malignant lesions, with 4 false-positive results.

Harms.evidence: No study-related severe adverse events were reported.
